p: The method of [ 38] was used to determine SOD activity by homogenizing the fresh aerial parts and fruits of selected taxa in phosphate buffer (50 mM, pH 7.8), EDTA (0.1 mM) and DTT (1 mM) following the procedure of [ 38] and was further analyzed by assessing its property to stop the photochemical reduction of nitro-blue tetrazolium as explicated by [ 39]. One unit of SOD activity was demarcated as the amount of enzyme causing 50% inhibition of photochemical reduction of nitro-blue tetrazolium. Absorption was measured in Double Beam Spectrophotometer (Hitachi u-2800).
